intro: Sida cordifolia var. conferta, commonly known as the clustered heartleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, showing some degree of salt tolerance. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. The leaves are often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
